intro: Leonurus globosus, commonly known as hedgehog's breakfast, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its unique, rounded flower heads resemble miniature globes, giving it an unusual and eye-catching appearance. It thrives in dry, sunny conditions and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides.
